Five things that lead to the decline and: Mendicants memorize discourses that they learned incorrectly, with misplaced words and phrases.
Mendicants are hard to admonish, having qualities that make them hard to admonish.
Mendicants who are very learned don’t carefully make others recite the discourses.
Senior mendicants are indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion.
There’s a schism in the Saṅgha.
Five things that lead to the continuatio: Mendicants memorize discourses that have been learned correctly, with well-placed words and phrases.
Mendicants are easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish.
Mendicants who are very learned carefully make others recite the discourses.
Senior mendicants are not indulgent and slack, leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion.
The Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.
